intro: Ctenitis boholensis, commonly known as the Bohol fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of compound leaves that can reach several meters in height. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
